result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery Glen Johnson

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM Defendant Jeffery Glen Johnson appeared by video from the Pepin County Jail with counsel, Attorney Nicholis J Schroeder in person.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Johnson is on PO hold, WTL for PH.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:25 PM Defendant Jeffery Glen Johnson appeared by video from the Pepin County Jail without counsel.  Mr. Johnson requests representation.  Attorney Schroeder of PD appears by video.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Mr. Johnson is subject to cash bond, position on PH?  Mr. Johnson has applied to PD office.  Attorney Schroeder suggests waive TL for PH then your attorney can schedule PH.  Mr. Johnson believes he is on a PO hold.  On advise of counsel, court finds Mr. Johnson KVI WTL for PH.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

12:44 PM Defendant Jeffery Glen Johnson appeared by video from the Pepin County Jail.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Court advised defendant of charges in criminal complaint/max. penalties and rights.  Mr. Seifert - Mr. Johnson lives in MN but has significant actions of criminal law as of recent, convicted felon, on 2 deferred agreements from Eau Claire County, Misd. convictions in Clark Co.  Understand in Buffalo Co. recently concluded a # of cases and a # of related charges that were DRI.  He's on a Probation hold.  State believes he is a flight risk and ask cash bond $2500.00.  Mr. Johnson doesn't believe all that is correct, only on 1 deferred in Eau Claire, just got on probation and cooperating with Pepin County, ask cash bond reduced or signature bond.  Because you are on a probation hold at this time, Court impose a cash bond and reason why is you get credit for time spent in jail on a hold.  If I give you a signature bond, you can't do that.  Court will consider a request for signature bond if appropriate.  Court urges you to contact the PD office and discuss a PH in this matter.  The next hearing will be by zoom if in jail, if not, in person.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
